page.title: 10Education in Saxilby Area
page.content: Older children travel out of Saxilby for secondary education (at present being re-organised) but Saxilby Church of England Controlled Primary School caters for the 5-11 year olds. This Autumn term 1985 there are 253 pupils on roll with a teaching staff of 9 (including head teacher) supported by a caretaker, cleaner, 4 midday meals supervisors, a welfare assistant and secretary. This roll will rise to about 275 by the summer term 1986. For the 7 years 1974-1980 there were more than 400 children on roll during the summer term. The school was built in 3 separate phases between 1970 and 1976 and comprises 2 single storey blocks totalling 10 class areas without doors joined together by a square multi- purpose hall. Most children live near the school, a few are transported from nearby hamlets like Broxholme.
